intro: Gastrolepis, commonly known as the African snowball, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plants typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Many species of Gastrolepis produce small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring or early summer. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in drought conditions.
